𓏏 •dawn : rising sun 𓏏 𓇼 𓄿 𓇳 dawn 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | East, sunrise | Anatolia •turk شُرُوق šurūq זְרִיחָה

𓏏 •dusk დაისი daisi здрач : setting sun 𓏏 Dämmerung 𓏏 𓍃 𓐝 𓅱 𓀭 sun god 𓍃 𓅓 𓀭 Atum <> 𓍃 𓅓 𓅪 cease (setting sun) 𓏏 •dusk <> 𓇋 𓏏 𓈖 𓇳 disk 𓇋 𓏏 𓂞 𓀭 𓏏 •dusk 𐚩 •DU₂ 𓇶 in 𓇋 𓐍 𓐍 𓅱 𓇶 | twilight, dusk |

𓆄 𓏏 𓅂 | West, sunset

𓏏 temple tell 𒌋𒅗𒇺 ugu-dili₂ "upper part of the skull or scalp"

𓏏 ≈ 𒁹 'dash' in early texts of Fara & Abu Salabikh

𓈋 dual 2 < double 2 < dabr ⋍ደብር ⋍ ⲧⲱⲩ tvr > tell 𓏏𓏏 ⇔ Teil 𓈋

𓎆 ten
𓎅 tent
𓍸 demi δemi σemi semi (halb) schnitt𓍷
𓇿𓇿 tautal 𓊵 𓇾 ter
𓉿 door > dalet (ד), based on the Egyptian hieroglyph ‘door’

the most obvious letter of the hieroglyphic alphabet again with many cognates in European and semitic languages.

𓀒𓏏 throw down

Possible special reading for duplication 𓏏𓏏 Breδt ⇔ 𓅓Brut
1.) breast vs 𓏏𓏏 tit (bosom) 𓏏 #tulû ≈ tell
2.) bread (𓏏dough,𓏏teig)
3.) beide bi/di 𓏏𓏏dual

ض ḍ/b 𓏏?

D/B are both onomatopoetic and idiomatic: Breast Bulge Blow Bubble Beule Delle

BRδeiidt 𐀴 bThi ψ-ϑ 𓍿tChEi(n) 𐀯 山 (b)Thai => -ess S ⇔ 𓏏 te(ll) + (TR?)ell 𓎠 Tal / all 𓎟 vs Tasse 𓎡TC𓍿𓄑C 𐀲 kadd=jug

𓏏 tell talk (exaggerate) tall طويل (b)tawil tower ptolemy
